prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: SSA22 SMG Scan
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This science goal contain 12 SMGs. We will carry out spectral-scan.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
- Requested sensitivity:
The expected peak flux density and FWHM of the [CII] line is ~20 mJy and ~400 km/s for the faintest case. Considering the uncertainty in estimating the [CII] flux density, we adopt the expected flux for all targets. We request the sensitivity of 1-sigma = 2.0 mJy with 100 km/s binning. We will achieve >10-sigma in the typical cases and >5-sigma even in the faintest case. (please see Fig. 4 in the science case.)
- Imaging requirement:
Resolving the sources is not our aim. Therefore we request an angular resolution of ~0.5-1.0 arcsec to pinpointing the counterparts, which are obtained with the C34-1 configurations. (the expected source size is < 0.5") Snapshot images are sufficient for this project since our targets should be a point-like sources.
- Correlator setup:
We will use the spectral-scan mode with FDM 1875-MHz. Two frequency tunings cover 461.0-468.5 GHz. No special setup is intended.
- User-defined calibration:
None.
- Bandpass accuracy:
The expected FWZI of line is up to 1000 km/s. We don't need especially higher accuracies.
- Scheduling/time constraint:
None.
- Data rate:
0.7 MB/s, well below the data rate limit (12 MB/s)
- Special constraints:
None.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
Recently, we discovered a candidate for a extraordinary rich cluster of bright submillimeter galaxies (SMGs) at the core of the SSA22 protocluster at z=3.1. We find that 8 SMGs, which are likely to be at z=3.1, are concentrated within 12 Mpc region at the very center of the protocluster. Additionally 4 SMGs are also expected to be within the same protocluster.
However the deficit of secure spectroscopic redshifts for 9 out of 12 SMGs prevent us from clarifying the relation between the SMGs and the protocluster (Our photometric redshifts have the typical uncertainty of delta-z=0.5).
Here we propose to conduct spectroscopic observations with ALMA band 8 of the 12 SMGs to detect the [CII] 158 um emission line. We will utilize the spectral-scan mode and completely cover the redshift range of the protocluster (z = 3.06-3.12).
Our aim is
(1) to determine spectroscopic redshifts and unambiguously determine if the SMGs are associated with the protocluster. (2) to probe the nature of the SMGs using the [CII] line properties.
The proposed study should clarify the environmental dependence on SMG formation.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: code = 2012.1.00608.S, title = Biased Formation of SMGs in a z=3.1 Protocluster Core, PI=Hideki Umehata
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
